Key Arguments: The legislation will damage free speech, even if unintentionally.
Freedom of speech is a fundamental human right that must be safeguarded.
The bill violates the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, specifically Sections 18 and 19.
The definition of 'misinformation' as causing harm, including psychological harm, is subjective and open to misinterpretation.
Governments cannot regulate subjective interpretations of harm.
The bill represents an extreme overreach on freedom of speech.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is a fundamental human right and must be safeguarded.
This proposed bill is an extreme overreach of our freedom of speech.
It is simply not possible for governments to regulate such subjectivity.
